description:
Traceback in compute manager because get_host_uptime() doesn't receive 'host' argument.

There's some weird inconsistencies in these methods in general.  'host' doesn't need to be passed at all since the compute manager knows its own name.  Some methods were already fixed in the past, it appears, but not all.
title: compute.HostAPI.get_host_uptime() doesn't pass 'host' to manager

comments.content:
Traceback in compute manager because get_host_uptime() doesn't receive 'host' argument.

There's some weird inconsistencies in these methods in general.  'host' doesn't need to be passed at all since the compute manager knows its own name.  Some methods were already fixed in the past, it appears, but not all.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/11722

comments.content: Looks like you're not working on that anymore. Please set back to InProgress and reassign to you if you're working on proposing a change for merging.
